All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractValidator
AbstractValidator is the abstract base class used for implementing custom validators.
Email
Annotated field string value should be an email adress.
EmailValidator
This is a validator for validating email fields.
Length
Annotated fields string value length has to fit into constraints.
LengthValidator
This is a validator for validating string fields with a lenght-constraint
NotBlank
Annotated fields string value should not be blank.
NotBlankValidator
This is a validator for validating string fields that should not be blank.
NotEmpty
Annotated fields string value should not be empty.
NotEmptyValidator
This is a validator for validating that a field is not empty.
NotNull
Annotated fields value should not be null
NotNullValidator
This is a validator for validating fields that should not be null
POJOValidator
The object to be validated gets passed to this validator The validator than gets all the validators for the object specified by the annotations a field is annotated with.
Range
Annotated numeric field value should be in the specified range.
RangeValidator
This is a validator for validating numerical fields with a Range-Constraint
Regex
Annotated field string value should fit into specified regex pattern to pass.
RegexValidator
This is a validator for validating string fields with a pattern constraint.
Validator
The Validator is responsible for making sure that a value fits into the specified constraints
It returns if the value fits the constraints or not and also provides a descriptive error message.
ValidatorType
Is used to specify which validator is used when annotating a field with a Validator-Annotation
